title: Weekly sports quiz: How many UCL goals has Rashford scored for Barca?
summary: How much attention have you paid to what's happened in the world of sport over the past seven days?

title: Wembanyama stars as Spurs dominate Mavericks
summary: Victor Wembanyama records the fifth 40-point haul of his NBA career as the San Antonio Spurs beat the Dallas Mavericks.

title: Walsh makes Chelsea history on night of records for youthful Blues
summary: Reggie Walsh, 17, became the second youngest Englishman to play in the Champions League and the youngest Chelsea player to play in Europe's elite competition on Wednesday.

title: GB beaten to world gold by Netherlands in sprints
summary: Great Britain win silver in the women's and men's sprints at the Track Cycling World Championships in Santiago, Chile.

title: Why are the top strikers scoring more goals in modern football?
summary: Champions League pundit Guillem Balague believes with more teams playing man-to-man marking strikers in modern football are awarded more space to score goals and are also being given "individualised coaching" about how to exploit those spaces.

title: Rashford taking advantage of injuries, but needs to work harder - Balague
summary: Champions League Guillem Balague explains how "everybody loves" Marcus Rashford at Barcelona but that his work rate needs to improve off the ball, which is an issue across the squad in the big games.

title: Kane can't stop scoring - is the Ballon d'Or within reach?
summary: With 23 goals in 15 games for Bayern Munich and England this season, Harry Kane is emerging as an early frontrunner for the 2026 Ballon d'Or.

title: A glimpse of the future? Liverpool 'near perfect' despite Isak injury
summary: A night of bold calls pays off for Arne Slot as Liverpool return to winning ways at Eintracht Frankfurt, but it comes at a cost as Alexander Isak suffers a groin injury.

title: Spurs ride luck in Monaco but fans deliver verdict on dismal show
summary: Spurs rode their luck to earn a Champions League point in Monaco - but no-one will fear them on this evidence says chief football writer Phil McNulty

title: 'I won't throw anyone under the bus' - Swans boss Sheehan
summary: Alan Sheehan says he would "not throw anyone under the bus" after Malick Yalcouye's sending off in Swansea City's 1-0 home defeat to Queens Park Rangers.

title: Slot reveals Isak fitness worry
summary: Liverpool boss Arne Slot reveals he withdrew Alexander Isak at half-time against Eintracht Frankfurt because the striker had felt discomfort in his groin.

title: Sporting score late to seal comeback win over 10-man Marseille
summary: Alisson Santos' curling effort in the 86th minute gives Sporting victory over 10-man Marseille side at the Estadio Jos√© Alvalade in the Champions League.

title: Teenager Karl scores brilliant goal as Bayern thrash Club Brugge
summary: Lennart Karl becomes the youngest player to score for Bayern Munich in the Champions League, at 17 years and 242 days, as the German champions hammer Club Brugge 4-0 at the Allianz Arena.

title: Standout performance from Vicario earns Spurs a point at Monaco
summary: Tottenham Hotspur keeper Guglielmo Vicario makes a catalogue of saves to deny Monaco their first Champions League win of the season, as Thomas Frank's side earn a 0-0 draw at the Stade Louis-II.

title: Season opener cancelled after PGA fails to find new venue
summary: The PGA Tour cancels its 2026 season-opening event in Hawaii after failing to find an alternative venue to host The Sentry.

title: Allen & Brown progress to last 16 in Belfast
summary: Mark Allen wins a tense encounter with Ben Woollaston to progress to the last 16 of the Northern Ireland Open, while compatriot Jordan Brown books a third-round meeting with Shaun Murphy.

title: Bellingham gets first goal of season as Real see off Juventus
summary: Jude Bellingham's first goal of the season is enough to give Real Madrid a 1-0 win over Juventus at the Santiago Bernabeu in the league phase of the Champions League.

title: Three teenagers score as Chelsea thump 10-man Ajax
summary: Chelsea become the first team in Champions League history to have three teenage scorers as they secure a 5-1 win over a woeful Ajax side at Stamford Bridge.

title: Osimhen double gives Galatasaray comfortable win over Bodo/Glimt
summary: A first-half double from Victor Osimhen helps Galatasary overcome Bodo/Glimt 3-1 RAMS Park in the Champions League.

title: Guruzeta double helps Athletic Club to win over Qarabag
summary: Gorka Guruzeta scores twice to give Athletic Club a comeback 3-1 win over Qarabag and their first points of this season's league phase of the UEFA Champions League.

title: Haaland scores in 12th consecutive game as Man City see off Villarreal
summary: Erling Haaland finds the net for a 12th consecutive game to maintain his incredible goalscoring streak and help Manchester City end their winless away run in the Champions League with victory at Villarreal.

title: Inter thrash USG to maintain 100% start
summary: Inter Milan continue their perfect start to the league phase of the Champions League with a 4-0 win at Union Saint-Gilloise.

title: PSV stun Napoli with incredible comeback win
summary: PSV Eindhoven recover from a goal down to complete a dominant 6-2 win over Napoli in the league phase of the Champions League, as the Italian champions finish the game with 10 men.

title: Barnes scores twice as Newcastle beat Mourinho's Benfica
summary: A second-half double from Harvey Barnes helps Newcastle secure a 3-0 win over Jose Mourinho's Benfica at St James' Park in the Champions League.

title: PSG dominate Leverkusen in fiery encounter
summary: Defending champions Paris-St Germain thump Bayer Leverkusen 7-2 as both teams finish with 10 men in the league phase of the Champions League.

title: Gyokeres at the double as Arsenal thrash Atletico
summary: Viktor Gyokeres scores his first Champions League goals for Arsenal as the Premier League side dominate Atletico Madrid 4-0 at Emirates Stadium.

title: Ten-man Pafos hold on to secure point away to Kairat
summary: Despite a Joao Correia red card in the fourth minute, 10-man Pafos manage to hold on for a 0-0 draw at Kazakh champions Kairat Almaty in the Champions League.

title: Fabulous Lopez hat-trick gives Barca comfortable win
summary: Fermin Lopez hits a hat-trick, with Marcus Rashford scoring twice, as Barcelona thrash 10-man Olympiacos 6-1 in the league phase of the Champions League.

title: Ekitike sparks Liverpool comeback against Eintracht Frankfurt

title: Cholera kills more people for second consecutive year, while prevention and treatment available
summary: The global cholera statistics for 2024, shows an increase in both the number of people who fell sick and died from the disease.
